column4: Hey, I my memory (cache) are gradually being filled while I am using ubuntu. after a couple of hours the cache is on 75%, Is there a way to figure out how the cache is being filled like that? If any apps are leaking or what so?
linux by default keeps everything it can in memory, so any future operation needing the same data will be faster.
oooh o.O, and the cache is being emptied to let other apps use it when needed right. >)
